1.verse: A Slave Becomes a Christian - From Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and from Timothy, our brother. To Philemon, our dear friend and worker with us;

2.verse: to Apphia, our sister; to Archippus, a worker with us; and to the church that meets in your home.

3.verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I remember you in my prayers. And I always thank my God for you.

5.verse: I hear about the love you have for all God’s holy people and the faith you have in the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: I pray that the faith you share will make you understand every blessing that we have in Christ.

7.verse: My brother, you have shown love to God’s people. You have made them feel happy. This has given me great joy and comfort.

8.verse: Accept Onesimus as a Brother - There is something that you should do. And because of your love in Christ, I feel free to order you to do it.

9.verse: But because I love you, I am asking you instead. I, Paul, am an old man now, and a prisoner for Christ Jesus.

10.verse: I am asking you a favor for my son Onesimus. He became my son while I was in prison.

11.verse: In the past he was useless to you. But now he has become useful for both you and me.

12.verse: I am sending him back to you, and with him I am sending my own heart.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me to help me while I am in prison for the Good News. By helping me he would be serving you.

14.verse: But I did not want to do anything without asking you first. Then any favor you do for me will be because you want to do it, not because I forced you to do it.

15.verse: Onesimus was separated from you for a short time. Maybe that happened so that you could have him back forever—

16.verse: not to be a slave, but better than a slave, to be a loved brother. I love him very much. But you will love him even more. You will love him as a man and as a brother in the Lord.

17.verse: If you think of me as your friend, then accept Onesimus back. Welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If Onesimus has done anything wrong to you, charge that to me. If he owes you anything, charge that to me.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand. I will pay back anything Onesimus owes. And I will say nothing about what you owe me for your own life.

20.verse: So, my brother, I ask that you do this for me in the Lord. Comfort my heart in Christ.

21.verse: I write this letter, knowing that you will do what I ask you and even more.

22.verse: Also, please prepare a room for me to stay in. I hope that God will answer your prayers and I will be able to come to you.

23.verse: Final Greetings - Epaphras is a prisoner with me for Christ Jesus. He sends greetings to you.

24.verse: And also Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke send greetings. They are workers together with me.

25.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
